title: Integrating Generative AI with Science Education: Project-Based Learning with Action Research and AI-ICE Framework

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Design and implementation of science education scenarios utilizing generative AI tools in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment

learning_goals: Learners can creatively design three or more types of science education content using generative AI tools
Learners can develop at least two AI solutions for science education problems by applying the AI-ICE framework (Ideas, Connections, Extensions)
Learners can identify five or more ethical considerations when using generative AI and create science education guidelines reflecting these
Learners can qualitatively and quantitatively evaluate the effectiveness of AI-integrated science education projects using action research methodology

resources: Access to generative AI platforms (e.g., ChatGPT, Gemini)
Science education templates and assessment rubrics
PBL project management tools (e.g., Notion, Trello)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
